channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2023080633
item.description:
Report X-2023080633

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWING MOVEMENT THIS ALLOWED CAP TO BECOME CRACKED AND LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. BOX WAS UNDECLARED NO DIAMOND LABELS, UP ARROWS, HAZMAT SERVICE CODE OR ANY HAZMAT DOCUMENTATION. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX AND PRODUCT WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070316
item.description:
Report X-2023070316

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: SUMTER
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A SEVEN PIECE SHIPMENT FROM SC TO HONG KONG WAS STOPPED FOR INVOICE INSPECTION AT THE UPS ORIGIN FACILITY IN SUMTER, SC WHEN SMOKE WAS NOTICED RELEASING FROM ONE OF THE BOXES. THE RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE TO FIND LCD SCREENS FOR VARIOUS ELECTRONIC DEVICES. THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED AND ISOLATED THE WARM/SMOKING ITEMS WITH A TEMPERATURE GUN. SEVERAL LITHIUM ION BATTERIES WERE DISCOVERED STILL ATTACHED TO SOME OF THE LCD SCREENS. THE BATTERIES WERE CHARRED AND MELTED INDICATIVE OF A THERMAL EVENT. THE OUTER BOX SHOWS NO VISIBLE SIGNS OF A THERMAL EVENT. THE LCD SCREENS WITH ATTACHED BATTERIES INVOLVED IN THE THERMAL EVENT WERE ISOLATED AND ARE BEING HELD IN A SALVAGE DRUM FOR FAA INSPECTION. THE ADDITIONAL SIX BOXES WERE NOT OBSERVED TO CONTAIN ANY BATTERIES BUT ARE BEING HELD. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM SC USING UPS ACCOUNT 898FV2, TOPYET ELECTRONIC CO, UNIT 10/F BLK 03, KWUN TONG, HONG KONG. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023080923
item.description:
Report X-2023080923

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA Hazmat cage. During inspection it was found that the cap on the 5- gallon jug had failed to oporate. This caused a large amount of liquid to pour out of the plastic container. After the inspection was complete all contents within the package and jug were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent vaper and liquid from causing further damage. DescribePack: The failure was caused by the cap failing to operate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I attempted to tighten the jug but failed to do so as the cap was night airtight, and you could hear air escaping the closure. Package and all contents were placed into a hazmat bag tightened closed and placed into a 20-gallon drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was loaded on the rear end of the trailer and spilled. Unloading manager called me at 4pm and said there is a hazardous spill. They already had it a red hazardous tote so I didn't see what happened however it leaked either out of the cap or out of the bottom. DescribePack: It seems to be normal looking at it however it spilled either out of the top or the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I was not down there when it happened, yet it is suggested to have it on the floor towards the rear of the trailer. Non-hazardous packages should surround it and do not stack boxes of hazardous materials on top of each other.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg brought back to station by driver after recipient refused it due to mottling of box and bottom edge has disintegrated by becoming wet and separating. DescribePack: Contents are 2 part system of disinfectant and sterilant. Caps are vented and is fully disclosed on box exterior. The cap on one jug actually became loose which allowed internal leaking. When the cap was tightened, the jug became secure again. The cap may have been loose but not noticable until the jostling of the delivery van caused the package to actually leak. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The leak was a very small amount. It absorbed into the cardboard of the outer carton. No mitigation necessary as the package was segregated immediately upon return to station.

DescribePack: The screw on lid slightly leaked due to improper handling of the hazmat package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fold absorb was used for the small amount of liquid that needed cleaned up and the package was put into a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080068
item.description:
Report X-2023080068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA ALERTED TO LEAKING HAZMAT AROUND 5 AM. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, PACKAGE WAS PREVIOUSLY RTS'D DUE TO BEING AN IMPROPER HAZMAT. PACKAGE WAS NOT SHIPPED AS A HAZMAT AS IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN. NO DOT LABELS OTHER THAN THE STANDARD DIAMOND LABEL. NO HAZMAT PAPERWORK PROVIDED EITHER. THE PACKAGE HAD WENT OVERHEAD, AND SPILLED IN THE CHUTE AND ON THE FLOOR, APPROX. 2 CUPS OF LIQUID RESIN SPILLED. PACKAGE CONTAINED 2 METAL CANS OF PRIMER RESIN (APPROX 3.75 GAL OF RESIN TOTAL), NEITHER CAN HAD CLIPS TO SECURE THE LIDS. CLEANUP INCLUDED GLOVES AND ABSORBENT PADS. PACKAGE TAKEN AWAY FROM WORK AREA AND SET IN FRONT OF QA CAGE TO BE WORKED. DescribePack: 2 CANS NO CLIPS. 1 LID HAD BECOME LOOSE, LEAKING CONTENTS. BOTH CANS HAD ALSO BEEN DENTED NEAR THE LID. ONE CAN HAD A SMALL DENT, OTHER HAD A MEDIUM DENT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY SET ABSORBENT PADS ON THE SPILLED LIQUID TO PREVENT SLIPPAGE. PACKAGE TAKEN AWAY FROM WORK AREA TO PREVENT INHALATION

  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to failure of the container cap from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jug. Enviroserve personnel removed all freight from the pallet to verify that one jug was impacted. Enviroserve personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted trailer floor. The spent material was recovered and containerized into one 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The non-damaged freight was restacked onto a pallet and shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On July 24, 2023 at 1305 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Tulare, California regarding the release of approximately (1) pound of AZTEC 4.67G (UN2783, 6.1 III) from (1) plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to the cap being loose and popping off during load shift, and was contained to the inside of the trailer only. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE.   • Description: Veolia employee were loading the IBC onto a trailer at the 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when a leak was identified as coming from the bottom valve of the container. Upon further inspection, the valve completely snapped off resulting in a release of approximately 25 gallons of material onto the trailer floor and to the pavement beneath the trailer. The spill was quickly cleaned up and the remaining material in the IBC was transferred into a 55 gallon drum. The NRC was notified to report the release of a D003 material that exceed the RQ limit of 100 lbs.

  • City: DARDANELLE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 125-gallon tote of UN2428 was damaged due to improper bracing during transit and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the gravel, trailer, and soil. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews deployed poly sheeting to the impacted area and diluted the product with water. E3 personnel transferred the contents of the tote using a gravity transfer into a new tote. The tote was properly label and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove residual products and insure cleaning of the impacted cargo .A pressure washer was used to clean the outside of the trailer. All spent absorbents and impacted tote were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal

  • City: SAN JOSE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Environmental (AE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. AE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the concrete and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. Once all free product was collected, crews utilized a power washer to further remediate the surface and collected the rinsate in a vac-truck. All methylene chloride impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and transported to the RLC terminal to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Description: On July 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured by a nail and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews applied a patch to the damaged 5-gallon pail to contain the remaining product for disposal purposes. The impacted pallet was dismantled with a sawzall for disposal. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove any residual product from the impacted surfaces. The dismantled pallet and all UN3264-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal. The one (1) damaged pail was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

A total of 32 bottles were found damaged and containerized into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon vented poly drums. Absorbent pads were utilized to clean the released product. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

Report X-2023070401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE NEXT TO THE IRREG BELT WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THE TWO OF FOUR 1 GALLON BOTTLES CAPS WERE LOOSE. THE LEAKING BOTTLES LEAKED ON THE OTHER TWO BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023070400
item.description:
Report X-2023070400

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET/STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE CENTER CLERK AT THE WEST COUNTY BOXLINE-2 STATION. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALLS AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED FIBERBOARD PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST.

RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER USED SODIUM BICARBONATE ZEP ZORBENT TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL, SWEPT UP ALL CONTAMINATED ABSORBENT, PUT IT INTO ANOTHER LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER THEN TOOK THE PACKAGE TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX, FOUND THAT 1 GLASS BOTTLE WAS BROKEN HAD SOILED THE REMAINING BOTTLES.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY A TWO-PIECE CONSIGNMENT FROM INDIANA TO TEXAS WAS INSPECTED TO FIND FIVE MEDICAL DEVICES CONTAINING LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205648 CONTAINS FOUR STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENTS. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205657 CONTAINS ONE STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENT. EACH SURGICAL DEVICE CONTAINS ONE CR123A 3V LITHIUM METAL BATTERY IN THE EQUIPMENT. THERE IS NO LITHIUM BATTERY MARK APPLIED TO EACH BOX AS REQUIRED PER THE REQUIREMENTS OF IATA PI 967, SECTION II. THERE IS A PACKING LIST INSIDE EACH BOX WHICH INDICATES THE CONTENTS ARE HAZMAT. THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED OVERPACK. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that the leak was coming from where the handle was attached to the bucket. There was no damage observed to the lids or bottom chimes.   • Description: On 7/8/2023 at approximately 1100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill from a multiple-piece shipment. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing metal cans of paint. Two of the three pieces were compromised. The master shipment, ending in -5585, contained 4 cans of paint and the shipment ending in -5600 containing 2 cans paint. The master package had minor spillage the cause was unknown. One of the metal cans completely from the shipment ending in -5600, due to body structure failing. The remainder of both shipments wer placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

RMP WAS NOTIFIED OF THE PACKAGE AND CONTACTED THE HMSC TO REPORT THE INCIDENT. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1ZB370310308714308

item.title: Report X-2023071217
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Came off trailer #838446 already wet leaking and damaged. Package handler Gage Ettinger was lifting the box unaware that the package was wet and leaking, got on his shin of leg. Manager was notified took steps for first aid. Package handler is fine. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Artic Ice Machine Cleaner. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .70 gallons to release. A corrugated liner was used in box to separate the bottles in box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Artic Ice Machine Cleaner had a loose cap allowing .70 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package and was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection of box.

item.title: Report X-2023071215
item.description:
Report X-2023071215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: NASH admin discovered a leaking fiberboard box on the flexslide. Admin did not initially suspect this was a hazardous material as there were no diamond labels or hazmat paperwork attached to the packaging. Gloves were donned and package with all absorbed spillage was placed in a double-lined tote/bin and transported to the HMPA for further investigation. Pictures of the original packaging were found on Spidr. The shipper TRU VALUE/PROMAX could not verify the presence of a hazmat or whether content was (as stated on original packaging) six 1 gallon plastic bottles of Rooto 10% Ammonia; their SDS service through Ambipar could not provide any details of Section 14 of the SDS provided. In the shipper's SDS Section 14, all descriptors (except for PG: III) were listed as NA. The manufacturer Rooto Corp provided admin with an SDS Section 14 that described the material as UN2672, Ammonia solution, 8 III. PGH was kept informed of all developments. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process. DescribePack: One of six 1gal bottles lost 0.7 gallon due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned. The package and all spillage was placed in a double-lined, lidded tote and moved under ventilation for further investigation. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process.

The gasoline from each bottle spilled into the zip lock bag of absorbent. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Kept the bottle upright and placed into a drum to control the odor.

item.title: Report E-2023070903
item.description:
Report E-2023070903

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 446-gallon tote containing isopropanol experienced a faulty valve and released approximately one-half (.5) gallon of product to the concrete. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove residual products and insure cleaning of the impacted tote. Poly sheeting was placed around the tote as a precautionary measure. Upon further inspection of the value it was determined that a part would need to be order to repair the tote. Crews transferred the contents of the tote into nine (9) 55-gallon drums to be collected the following day. All spent absorbents, damaged pails, and impacted cardboard box were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly bag for transport and disposal. After receiving approval from on-site RLC representative, Mr. Eric Tisdale, MEG crews secured the site and scheduled their return at a later date to replace the valve and transfer the contents of the tote.

  • City: JERSEY CITY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 12, 2023, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3149 was damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted surfaces. MEG personnel noted one (1) empty gallon of UN3149 with residual material released to the surrounding cargo. The crew deployed absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to collect all UN3149-impacted materials into two (2) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. MEG personnel noted that no further actions were required on site and crews demobilized.

item.description:
Report E-2023070606

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: FLORENCE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/16/2023, at 1720 hours, personnel in the CSX Florence Yard (Florence, SC) discovered DAKX 29917, a loaded tank car of Ethylene Glycol, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Sabic, was notified (CHEMTREC Report 2023-0716-00035). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found liquid product to be leaking between the liquid line valve mounting flange and the cars pressure plate. Contractor personnel vented the cars pressure to stop the release. The issue identified and containment measures were communicated to Sabics representative- Greg Horton (Greg.Horton2@Sabic.com, 812-305-2295). The car was held at the CSX Florence Yard pending additional repair and qualification or OTMA.

item.title: Report X-2023070285
item.description:
Report X-2023070285

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DMP RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR ON THE PD8 FROM THE DOCK SUPERVISOR WHICH WAS DISCOVERED BY THE PICKOFF. THE BELT WAS SHUT OFF AND SUCURED AND THE AREA WAS EVACUATED. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNING THE CORRECT PPE RESPONDED TO THE AREA WITHIN 5 MINUTES AND USING THE DECISION TREE, IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAINED IT. THE OUTER CARTON OF THE PACKAGE WAS VISIBLY STAINED ON THE BOTTOM AND THE SIDES BUT NOT LEAKING OUTSIDE ONTO THE SURROUNDING AREA. THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING AND FURTHER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE INNER BLADDERS WAS PUNCTURED AND HAD LEAKED APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was scanned to work area 141 at 9:43 am on 07/17/2023. Then at 12:01 pm It was scanned code 10 (inspection required). Package was left at QA1 in a plastic bag with the package covered in white paint. When QA arrived in the morning and began to process packages left at QA1 the packages was found in the damaged package area. Upon closer inspection it was found that the package was a HazMat. Package was placed in salvage drum secured to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Inside the package was found 4 x 1 gallon paint cans. All 4 were dented, soiled/stained in white paint, and 1 had its top come off and was empty. 90% of the interior of the package was coated in paint. Approximately 60% of the exterior of package was coated in white paint. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was found inside of a clear plastic bag at QA1 damaged package area. Then placed in a salvage drum by QA when it was discovered that it was a HazMat. After which it was secured to be processed post sort.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer 568921 from the unload already wet leaking and damaged. Package was placed in a lined red tote and taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Foam Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .20 gallons to release. Corrugated liner was on the top of the bottles and a liner was separating the bottles inside box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Foam Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner had a loose cap allowing .20 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the damaged leaking package, taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and placed on the rollers. Package handler did not notify management hazmat had internal leak. ( Package handler may have been un aware.) Package was moved from 1 set of rollers to a second set. I was told package had spilled out onto a Package handlers shirt and his stomach is now irritated. SCMS was entered on package handler and hazmat was taken to hazmat area where was placed into a hazmat bag and spill bin. DescribePack: Hazmat states it has venting caps on product and that product is placed inside a small bag and then packaged into box with packing material ( Fiberboard Liners) package must have been loaded sideways at some point in transit because the leaking from the vent cap. Eventually pressure caused plastic bag to burst and material to leak out of plastic bag and cause internal leak and then eventually leaking onto package handlers shirt. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Once discovered package was taken to hazmat cage and placed into hazmat bag and spill bin.

item.title: Report E-2023070867
item.description:
Report E-2023070867

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Binghamton NY facility received a trailer with a release of profile 60-2605 (Press Wash Solvent and Inks) from Amcor Flexibles North America. The flammable liquid waste material that leaked from drums. One drum was overpacked with leaks around the top lid seals (red drum picture). Site personnel replaced the lid seal but identified damage around the lid area and drum was overpacked. The main leaking drum that coated the trailer in blue was identified with a small pin hole on bottom chime. Assumed to be from a puncture. Furthermore, a few other issues were also identified. The lid closure rings for a few drums appeared to be missing nuts to property seal the lids and the outside condition of the drums was extremely poor. The paint on the outside of the drums is causing issues with identifying the remaining leaking drum(s). The customer was contacted to address the closure and condition of the containers offered for shipment.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS DUE TO RECENT UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMONDS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX ORAL SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST SHIPPING BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED TO THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY AND WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.description:
Report E-2023070809

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 11, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the dock floor due to a loose cap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ES personnel tightened the cap on the 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide. Crews utilized absorbents and a neutralizing agent to clean the top of the 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid (UN3266) was damaged during transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed all the freight was removed and shipped. The two (2) 5-gallon jugs left were not damaged. LSH personnel utilized absorbent wipes to wipe down the impacted area. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070793
item.description:
Report E-2023070793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: GALLIPOLIS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 7, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of acetone were dropped due to mishandling and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. TLE noted that the material had hardened to the dock floor. The crew utilized acetone and hand tools to removed the product from the dock floor. All damaged pails, impacted absorbents, and product were contained in two (2) 35-gallon drums of waste. Following approval from the onsite contact, TLE secured the waste for delivery to the R+L terminal in Wilmington.

item.title: Report E-2023070791
item.description:
Report E-2023070791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics - LHO experienced a UN1263 E347 Genie Blue (APS) Equipment Enamel release from a 5-gallon metal pail and a UN1263 Endura Paint Topcoat A White (APS SA Panel) release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel has already conducted cleanup. It was advised approximately 1-ounce of UN1263 E347 Genie Blue (APS) Equipment Enamel was released due to improper loading and 1-cup of UN1263 Endura Paint Topcoat A White (APS SA Panel) released to the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The product were containerized into a 10-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070784
item.description:
Report E-2023070784

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1197 Caramel Flavoring release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum and one cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070336
item.description:
Report X-2023070336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023070336, X-2023070459: Package was offered to the spill clean up specialist at our station location in Dothan, AL. Discovered during AM sort operations, package was seen to wet on outside of fibreboard box indicating leakage from inside. Further inspection found that package contained 4 plastic jugs each containing 3.78L of Alligare Diquat Herbicide (UN 1760) placed in a Surge Broadleaf Herbicide for turf box, UN 3082. Each set of 2 jugs was placed in a plastic moisture barrier before being placed in the box. It was seen leakage originated from the caps of the bottles and is believed to have been caused by expansion due to local heat. SDS of Surge Broardleaf Herbicide shows commodity could travel under special provision A197. However, the SDS also shows product has a flash point of 57 C and a boiling point of 100 C. Flammable, packing group III. There are no marks nor labels on the package indicating the product being shipped was flammable. SDS for Alligare Diquat shows commodity would be classified as UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, N.O.S (contains diquat dibromide) There were no marks nor labels to indicate a corrosive product was being transported. Package was contained at location and is awaiting FAA disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023070963
item.description:
Report E-2023070963

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: STONE MOUNTAIN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: METRO PETRO LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The truck and trailer were traveling East in US 78 in Stone Mountain GA. The driver then took the W Park Pl Blvd exit and proceeded to turn right onto W Park Pl Blvd. There is a traffic light at the intersection and the driver had the green light. As the driver was completing the turn, he felt the trailer shift and when he checked in his mirrors, he observed the trailer rolling over. The truck did not attempt to roll over and he was able to pull the truck over to the side of the road and stop. The trailer rolled onto the lift side then top and the right side landed on top of a car waiting at the traffic signal which was red. There was another car in front of the car it landed on and it struck the rear of the car which was later driven from the scene buy the occupants. The seam split on the lower left of the tank which did not leak because of the final resting position of the tank, it was at the top above the level of the fuel. The crack was a direct result of the rollover. The crack was later enlarged to facilitate the removal of the fuel from that compartment. The rear most top inspection hatch was leaking and the fire department added an additional clamp to the lid to slow the leak and they put a containment pool under the lid to catch the leaking fuel. The bulkheads between compartments 4, and 5 the comp internally ruptured into the void. Holes were then drilled into the side of the trailer which were facing up and the majority of the fuel was pumped from the trailer while it was on it's side. The trailer was the righted and the remaining fuel was pumped from the load heads on the bottom of trailer. The fire department made a small earthen dam to stop the flow of fuel from the small leaks while we were waiting for the Hazmat cleanup companies to arrive. They then use absorbent material and booms to catch and contain the small leaks.

  • City: OCALA

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found and offered to the dangerous goods specialist at our Ocala Fl station location during morning sort. Package was a plastic pak and employee could hear what they describe as a metal ball rattling. They believed the package could contain an aerosol can inside. Package was opened for inspection and a spray can of Alu-Mend was found inside. Label on can claimed contents to be flammable and under pressure. There were no DG marks nor labels to indicate package contained an aerosol. Package has been held at station location pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023070251
item.description:
Report X-2023070251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: NEW YORK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found brough to the attention of the spill specialist at one of our station locations in New York, NY. Part of a multi piece shipment, package was emitting a strong odor, however, a smudge of what looked like grey-green paint was seen on yellow tape on box. Package was opened at the request of Dangerous Goods Administration, and it was seen a green paint like substance had leaked in the package. Package was reported to contain a metal can which was bent and release an estimated 2 KG (L) of product. Bubble wrap was used to wrap the can and as dunnage. Originating in Hong Kong Paperwork traveling with the package indicated the package contained a waterproof coating which should have been milky white in color. However, the can inside stated the contents were "Xincaihong Special Ink" and was not the color the SDS indicated. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and has been held at the station location pending FAA investigation.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG.

  • City: LAREDO

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 3, 2023, at 1212 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallon of IMEP-SAS 2011 (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., (Methanol), UN1993, 3, III) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote due to load shift. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release impacted the whole trailer floor and was contained to a 20' x 5' area in the yard. All waste generated was containerized in the (1) IBC tote that was damaged which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, A PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM USA TO UNITED KINGDOM WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. THE TOP OF THE BOX SHOWED SIGNS OF A DENT. THE OUTER BOX HAD AN IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION WITH PROPER MARKS AND LABELS APPLIED. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS FOUND TWO X ONE GALLON METAL CANS OF PINEAPPLE EXPRESS AND GRAPE APE FLAVORED TERPENES. THE PINEAPPLE EXPRESS CAN WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE SIGNS OF THE CLOSURE OR CAN BEING DAMAGED. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1FE015, THE PERFUMER'S APPRENTICE, 170 TECHNOLOGY CIRCLE, SCOTTS VALLEY CA 95066.

item.title: Report X-2023070093
item.description:
Report X-2023070093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION BY RESPONDER REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALL AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

THE LID ON THE METAL CAN HAD COME LOOSE DURING SHIPMENT, ALLOWING THE PAINT TO ESCAPE AND STAIN THE OUTER CARTON PLUS INNER CAN, ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSSED THROUGH THE DMP.

  • City: BANGOR
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer location for a waste pickup. Upon opening the trailer door the driver discovered that the trailer floor was wet and smelled strong odor. Driver immediately called dispatch and placed spill pads and speedy dry to contain the liquid to the trailer. Management called for emergency response to respond. Response time was 2-3 hours. Driver stayed with the vehicle until the response crew arrived and material was transferred into another 5 gallon drum. Original drum was placed in an overpack along with any cleanup materials that were used. Cause of the failure was determined to be missing gasket and ring for drum was put on upside down. In addition to the missing gasket there was a pinhole discovered in the side of the drum where the drum had been picked for loading.

item.title: Report E-2023070770
item.description:
Report E-2023070770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: Grafton
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/23/2023, at 1332 hours, personnel in the CSXT Grafton Yard discovered TILX 198280, a loaded tank car of Alcohols, N.O.S., leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, West Virginia DEP, and National Response Center were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2023-0623-00192). Specialized Professional Services, Inc, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the reclosing pressure relief device stuck in the open position that resulted in the release of lading while the car was in motion. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Ms. Judy Watson of Valero Marketing, phone (210) 241-2886, email judy.watson@valero.com. Contractor personnel manually reset the pressure relief device. The contents of the car were transloaded without incident, and the car will move to a shop of the car owner's choice with an OTMA-1 per 49 CFR 174.50. (FRA assigned Investigators have been updated) The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is required. Cause Code: 422 NARRI: 32

item.title: Report I-2023070003
item.description:
Report I-2023070003

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRITISH AIRWAYS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment 125-59261624 was tendered to British Airways in Washington Dulles Airport. The shipment originated from shippper Sky2C Freight Systems and had been declared as Lithium Ion Batteries in Compliance with Section Il of PI 967. During the acceptance and inspection process of the cargo on June 27, 2093 and 10:39, staff identified that the cargo had been labeled with Class 9 labels and Cargo Aircraft Only. The shipment was rejected and returned to the shipper. On June 28th at 13:13, Sky2C retendered the same shipment. During the inspection of the cargo during acceptance, staff identified that their were additional boxes that were marked as Class 9 and Cargo Aircraft Only with the labels facing towards the center of the pallet. The cargo was again refused and returned to the customer.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN TWO, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUGS, OF ALPHA 90 IA FLUX, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN3624, CORROSIVE,LIQUID, ACIDIC, INGORANIC, N.O.S.; (HYDROCHLORIC ACID, ZINC CLORIDE); 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 2 GAL). UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED ONE OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE ACID TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTER CARTON PLUS THE OTHER INNER BOTTLES. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT LOADING DOCK RERUN SLIDE OF THE EARTH CITY MO UPS HUB. THE PACKAGE (A 12X12X12IN 44LBS EDGE CRUSH TEST FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS FOUND LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID. THE SPILL WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO ABUSE FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. AN INTERAL INSPECTION REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE 3 INNER RECEPTICLES (1GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES) HAD LEAKED ABOUT 2 OUNCES OF LIQUID, CONTAMINATING ALL THREE BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUG, OF CALCI-SOLVE SUPER STRENGTH DESCALER, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN1789, HYDROCHLORIC ACID SOLUTION, 8, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 1 GALLON). ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to our spill office located in our Memphis Hub location when it was seen package was leaking. Package consisted of a steel drum containing UN3082. It was seen upon arrival of spill cleanup agent that the top chime of the drum was damaged. It was not known how the damage to the drum occurred. It was also seen commodity was leaking from cap placed in bung hole allowing for an estimated 5L to spill. Package to be placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper is to be contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for return to shipper as FedEx Policy does not allow for international shipment of salvage drums.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUGS OF STATE FLOOR WIZARD, HIGH PERFORMANCE FLOOR STRIPPER, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT (UN3267, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, BASIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S, (ETHANOLAMINE), 8, PG II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 4 GAL). THE CAPS ON ONE OF THE FOUR JUGS HAD COME LOOSE, WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE CORROSIVE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE INNER PLASTIC JUGS, PLUS THE OUTER CARTON. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

  • Description: On 05/14/2023, during the meal delivery phase of the flight, a passenger seated in 16E entered the forward (FWD) galley with a smoking e-cigarette. The device was hot to the touch. The passenger notified the Flight Attendant that the device would not stop smoking. The Flight Attendant proceeded to place the device in to a cup of water. The device was then placed in a fire containment bag with two large bottles of water. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No injuries were reported.

  • Description: On 05/24/2023 while on a return trip from Heidelberg Materials in Jordanville, O'brien Brickey was traveling west on Rt. 5S toward Utica. As he crossed over a bridge he noticed material white in color coming out of the back of the truck(270). O'Brien pulled over immediately to check out the truck upon doing so noticed there was emulsion flowing out from what appeared to be several places. O'Brien immediately called his supervisor Derrick Paro who instructed him to call PERS and also NY DEC was notified. O'Brien was told by PERS that appropriate personnel would be dispatched for cleanup. The site was cleaned up and there is nothing further at this time.

  • Description: On 05/30/2023 at approximately 0200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 245617 at the station location in Burlington, reporting an undeclared flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 1 plastic bottle of Arm-R-Seal, packed in a fiberboard box. The package raised suspicion because it displayed orientation arrows and made a liquid sound . The SDS found online by the agent classifies the commodity as UN 1263. The package was not prepared with the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2023050050
item.description:
Report I-2023050050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: PORT ARTHUR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 00:30 on 1/6/2023, Kansas City Southern Railway's (KCS) Environmental & Hazmat Department was notified of an Ammonia odor in the KCS Port Arthur, TX rail yard. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate the odor. Upon arrival, responders Identified SHPX 221270 as the leaking tank car. Responders dawned proper PPE before ascending the car. Once on top of SHPX 221270 , responders found the A-side liquid valve less than tool tight and the A-side liquid valve plug was also less than tool tight. Estimated release was 3 gallons. The liquid valve and the plug were both secured tool tight. Once secure, the rail car was released back Into transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
